pros: Big group of friends hanging out during training 10/10 would recommend
cons: Literally none, this position was so fun and I wish I could go back and do it again

pros: Students are great, for the most part.
cons: Anyone higher up than your chair is out for themselves, and won't listen to Faculty. Has resulted in some not-surprising failures and debt campus wide.

review_title: Depends on which department you work in
pros: paid holidays hybrid work schedule great neighborhood elevated DEI efforts being made
cons: some offices have more/less autonomy than others

pros: It was a great place that I loved until a swift change during the pandemic
cons: I don’t think they did a great job at change management during a major layoff during the pandemic.

review_title: WIT does not necessarily fire you - may pay you to leave and never come back to campus or just then terminate you
pros: Pretty sure this is what happened to people (or person) in Dec. 2021.
cons: Pretty sure this is what happened to people (or person) in Dec. 2021. Prob set him up to pay rest or most of his contract. He probably cannot come back to campus. It was either accept the payout or just leave with nothing.

pros: Great Location. Everything else is terrible.
cons: Poor schedule, disrespectful superiors, average student quality is substandard, shared offices (sometimes with multiple people), worst benefits I have ever seen (This is my 5th workplace in academia). Your opinion is asked and ignored everytime which makes you look small. DO NOT COME HERE UNLESS YOU ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO.

job_title: Student Accounts Counselor in Boston, MA
pros: Hybrid schedule and have lots of holiday breaks off when campus is closed.
cons: Workplace environment is bad, the actual physical office has holes in the ceiling and rains on computers, which seems real dangerous.

job_title: Technical Support Specialist in Boston, MA
pros: This environment is a welcoming and relaxed position. Everyone is very nice and is happy to teach you any needed skills. Especially great for part time Wentworth Students.
cons: No cons really as this is a part time position.

pros: Good people, good programs, and students are there for a quality purpose. Benefits were good until the pandemic. Learned a lot.
cons: Unclear leadership in multiple departments. No advancement opportunities. Supervisors sending conflicting information/actions to their staff. Lack of HR resources to step in when needed.

pros: A great way to make a little bit of money during the school year while also gaining experience on how to teach and mentor others. Tutoring has also led me to create a few good friends and I would recommend to someone who qualifies.
cons: You have to sit in on classes so the hours are not flexible but, the head of scheduling does a good job of integrating the hours around your schedule. Pay is okay at 15 dollars an hour.

pros: Summer pay is the same as Spring/Fall. 10% 401k match
cons: Terrible leadership. Provost, all deans & associate deans, 25% of staff, and many faculties were leaving in the past 2 years. They are trying to kick off old people and replace them using adjunct/ new people to reduce costs.

pros: Located in downtown Fenway area of Boston provides easy access and plenty of off-campus dining and cultural opportunities. The students are hard-working and well-prepared. The facilities are clean and modern.
cons: Administration wants to run the University only on adjunct faculty, and pay full-time professors the leas they can. The recent change in school structure has overloaded faculty with unreasonable amount of service work that the department chairs, deans, and administrators used to do. There has been an exodus of dedicated faculty and staff in the last 2 years due to disagreements with the administration.

job_title: Mechanical Engineering Lab Assistant in Boston, MA
pros: Very good opportunity for college students.
cons: Every year you do the same things.

pros:
Co-Op Program
Accredited by ABET
Good faculty and staff
cons:
Poor leadership
Understaffed administration
Location isn't great

pros: Good entry leave place to start.
cons: Over all low pay scale.

pros: Amazing faculty and students. Dedicated to student success.
cons: Could foster more community building

job_title: Associate Dean of Students in Boston, MA
pros: Great students, great community, great vision for the future
cons: none to share at this time

pros: Can do homework, flexible hours, 20 hours max
cons: Doesn't pay much more than minimum salary

pros: Supportive coworkers (faculty and staff)
cons: Like everywhere else in academia: few opportunities for tenure.

review_title: Great environment, Good school but faculty keeps leaving....
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor, Physics in Boston, MA
pros:
Friendly and relaxed setup
good academics
cons:
not many opportunities to advance for visiting faculty
strong preference to offer tenure track positions to very young PhD
many faculty members have left in just a few years and partially replaced

review_title: Academic staff not valued or respected
pros:
It is a job in Boston
The health benefits are pretty good
As a small institution, theoretically you can have a larger influence than at a big university
cons:
Very few opportunities for promotion
Class inequality system among faculty vs staff vs leadership
No respect for workload or mental health

job_title: IT Business Systems Analyst in Boston, MA
pros: Good work and life balance
cons: No opportunity for career path

pros: Wentworth has a great student body!
cons: Leadership is divisive! Every school has leadership turnover every semester. The university has fired a significant portion of staff with no cause. Each department has lost about 30% of its faculty.

pros: Good Students to teach and work with.
cons: A Toxic, Authoritative  Administration that allows no dissension or discussion whatsoever.

pros: Work is self directed with minimal micromanagement
cons: Administration is not sensitive to the needs of the department

pros: Wentworth is a great place to gain practical experience and useful knowledge.
cons: It's a pretty expensive school.

pros: Good flexibility, allows adequate independence
cons: Club sports is a bit of a mess right now, but it's understandable due to covid.

job_title: Student Lab Technician in Boston, MA
pros: Lots of time to do homework, pay is good
cons: The work is not demanding or difficult

review_title: Great People; Communication between offices can be better
pros: Great community, great for new comers to High Ed;
cons: Can be difficult to move up; communication between offices causes issues

pros: Team is awesome and great work enivornment
cons: There are no cons here

pros: Caring faculty & staff, great education at a good value.
cons: During my time there, leadership was stale (many had served in same role for over a decade). This has since changed.

pros: there is a good coop program
cons: there isn't much diversity on campus

pros: Great time at Wentworth enjoy the people
cons: The pay is very low

review_title: Great school to be apart of
pros: Lots of opportunities to work with other professionals from all walks of life. Hands on learning and great resources for students
cons: Feels as though some classes are not rigorous enough or taught well enough, especially in the programming fields.

review_title: Great place to head start your career
pros: Considering it is a small university, resources are easy to find.
cons: As with many companies, the university lacks diversity.

pros: Overall, it was a fun experiance
cons: There are no cons that I recall

pros: Good pay and new facilities
cons: parking, food, gas, and traffic

pros: Everyone here was nice to work with.
cons: Cannot think of any cons

pros: Always thinks about you first and helps you become the best person

job_title: Biomedical Engineering Assistant in Boston, MA
pros: Worked Around My Class Schedule
cons: Low Pay And Low Level Work

pros: Lots of collaboration, motivation to move up, support from colleagues
cons: Currently not feeling support from upper administration for COVID-related concerns.

pros: Good value, challenging, prepares you.
cons: Challenging, dorms are not great.

pros: Great to work during school
cons: Shifts only available per class, and must fit into a school schedule

pros: Great Benefits and a diversified environment
cons: Need more organization throughout the company as a whole

pros: Staff like working here and many of them have long careers and great experience to bring to their jobs. The focus of the whole campus is on the students. Employees at all levels really care for the students and strive for them to succeed in their education. Changes that have been happening recently are a good sign, an indication of smart moves towards a positive future. If the pace of change keeps up, staff will have a better working environment and students better quality educational opportunity and attainment.
cons: Older employees that need to go are not let go. Teams are dragged down by under-performing members. Administration is secretive. Things take a long time to change. Lack of communication between departments.

review_title: Wentworth lacks communication across campus and down through the ranks, creating a dysfunctional work environment
pros:
Enjoyable/smart colleagues
Easy access to the city
On the T
On campus parking available
Generous holiday time off
Active in Boston community
Consortium of area Colleges to interact with
Students are very down to earth
cons:
Departments operate in silos
Some senior management are not skilled in their positions
Communication is lacking and slow
Goals and objectives are not done or clear
Work/life balance, in some areas, not respected
Information sharing is difficult
Lack of understanding in building long term relationships
High turnover in some departments making project execution difficult

job_title: Assistant Professor, Chemistry in Boston, MA
pros: Great sciences department. Still growing, with exciting things on the horizon. Faculty, especially the newer faculty, are pumped about working there.
cons: University tends to be stuck in its ways.  Need to raise admissions standards a bit, and raise the minimum passing grade for prerequisite courses, especially in math, science and engineering.  Setting low standards is not helping students learn and succeed, it just ensures they graduate.  We need to be sending students out into the world prepared.

review_title: Wonderful people and a great place to learn.
pros: The people in my division were really great and allowed me to really break out of my role to volunteer with other things.  Everyone was very supportive of professional development and continuing education.
cons: Salary and benefits weren't stellar.  I believe after I left they became even more strict about eligibility.  There's not much room for promotion either as people tend to stay for a very long time.

pros:
Collaborative, supportive, and room for growth. 
Professional development is strongly encouraged. Great office culture and supportive management.  Good retirement benefits.
cons: Low salary leads to high turnover and some morale issues. Expensive health insurance and limited incentives for health. Old school mindset means lack if schedule flexibility.

review_title: I worked at the manufacturing lab as a 3D printer laboratory.  They flexible and I enjoyed working there.
pros: They were very Flexible, friendly and understanding.  The place is always clean.  They have many different types of 3D Printers.
cons: Lab gets very busy at the end of the semesters. 3D print section is little small.

pros: Good location. Near both the Orange Line and Green Line, many bus lines and you get discounted T passes. Lots of places around to go for lunch.
cons: High teaching load, low salaries, managers ineffective to vindictive, code of silence. No input from faculty in to your work or work environment. Not a place to show any initiative as failure is not tolerated. Expectations from students that they should all get As. Don't trust anyone.

job_title: Researcher and Student in Boston, MA
pros: Researching at Wentworth provides good field experience, and teaches new skills that are applicable in future career internship positions and relevant jobs.
cons: Wentworth does not pay students very much, even though most of the money comes directly from federal funding programs as part of tuition assistance

pros: High autonomy in your classes, departmental support without much pressure, and the students are generally delightful.
cons: The standard woes of adjuncting. Generally, you are better off not, but if your situation is such that you have to, here is probably a bit better than most.

review_title: Overall a good enviroment to work in, however lack of communication from both management and faculty is lacking
pros:
Friendly coworkers
Enjoyable working enviroment
good benifits
cons:
low pay in comparison to similar positions at other universities
full teaching load prevents the ability to develop research programs

pros: Friendly, diverse student population. Freedom and flexibility in curriculum and instruction.
cons: Sometimes being an adjunct can feel a little isolating, as there aren't many opportunities to connect on campus. That said, it is nice that we have autonomy.

pros: I am able to do my homework while doing my student job at a college.
cons: I am unable to use what I learn in my classes.

pros: Relatively small so more opportunity to take on additional responsibilities than at other colleges.
cons: This is a very poorly managed place.  HR is terrible...there is an inner circle here.  If you're connected to it you can do anything you want and your job will be safe.  If you aren't in it then good luck!

pros: Great holiday time, good work environment, and wonderful location.  Just fantastic to gain experience.
cons: For many positions there aren't many ways to go up.

review_title: Nice place to work with, they provide parking place in the longwood area!
pros: No grant pressure; supportive in teaching
cons: As most of the places, lots of polics

pros: Great teachers and staff.   The students are very engaged.
cons: I do not have any "cons" for this employer.  They were very dedicated to the student's learning and have a great internship program.

pros: Because Wentworth is a teaching institute the students greatly benefit from constant interaction with the faculty.
cons: If you are interested in research then Wentworth is likely not the place for you.

pros: work study job interviews are not tough. flexible hours. plenty of job opportunities
cons: when you're not able to make your shift, it's sometimes hard to find a replacement or call out

review_title: Great place to work for, even as an adjunct.
pros: Friendly atmosphere, very helpful and supportive.
cons: None against the college, mostly against the adjuncts culture that is prevalent in the higher-education today.

job_title: Manufacturing Lab Assistant in Boston, MA
pros: a lot of fun and useful opportunities are available, and the small classes allow for close student-teacher relationships
cons: during summer semesters, there aren't many class options available

The co-op program is excellent
Good professors for the most part (and not strict about being late, like some other schools)
Diverse student body
cons: Some professors have really thick accents

pros: Excellent school, my experience instructing there was nothing short of exemplary.
cons: The Architecture Department could use an expansion to accommodate for growing number of students.

pros: The commute is wonderful and easy.
cons: Underappreciated, Overworked and Underpaid in comparison to other colleges.

pros: Fairly small, so it's easy to communicate with other departments and work together.
cons: There's a lot of red tape, since risk management is a priority
